abstract: Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis said his company is still in talks with U.S. officials on how to compensate the government for a prior loss-sharing agreement, according to a letter released by a watchdog lawmaker on Thursday.
snippet: Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis said his company is still in talks with U.S. officials on how to compensate the government for a prior loss-sharing agreement, according to a letter released by a watchdog lawmaker on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis said his company was still in talks with federal officials on how to compensate the government for a prior loss-sharing agreement, according to a letter released by a lawmaker on Thursday.

headline.main: Lawmaker Slams Bank of America on Bailout Exit
